source_sentence: ◎佛世尊遊舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: The Bhagavān traveled to Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 波斯匿大臣伊沙多富蘭那[打-丁+翕]跋提見諦人，將諸比丘往看軍馬。
translation: Seeing the truthful man, the minister of Prasenajit, Isadolfranna[d-din+open]Bhadrika, sent the monks to see the army and horses.

source_sentence: 諸比丘亦有親里在軍中，留比丘住三日。
translation: The monks also had relatives in the army who stayed with the monks for three days.

source_sentence: 諸長者見，自相謂言：「此沙門釋子出家為道，必當傳彼此語。」
translation: When the elders saw this, they said to each other, "This ascetic and Śākyamuni left home to follow the path, and he will surely transmit his words to one another."

source_sentence: 十二法比丘聞，往白世尊。
translation: When the twelve monks of the Dharma heard this, they went to the Bhagavān and told him.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「若比丘在軍中，不得過再宿，若過者墮。」
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "If a monk is in the army, he mustn't stay overnight again; if he does, he'll fall into the trap."

source_sentence: 拘薩羅波斯匿王講武戲軍，諸比丘往看。
translation: The king of Kośala Prasenajit was discussing military sports, and the monks went to watch.

source_sentence: 諸長者見，自相謂言：「此沙門釋子非其所習而來觀看。」
translation: When the elders saw them, they said to each other, "This ascetic and Śākyamuni son didn't come to watch what he had practiced."

source_sentence: 十二法比丘聞，往白世尊。
translation: When the twelve monks of the Dharma heard this, they went to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「若比丘，講武戲軍、若觀軍鹵簿幢麾者，墮。」
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "Suppose a monk talks about military sports or observes the military's marshals and banners, he'll fall down."

source_sentence: 佛世尊遊舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: The Bhagavān traveled to Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時六群比丘常與十七群比丘共諍。
translation: At the time, six groups of monks were always at odds with seventeen groups of monks.

source_sentence: 六群比丘自恃豪姓，打十七群比丘。
translation: The six groups of monks, proud of their noble lineage, beat up the 17 groups of monks.

source_sentence: 諸長者見，自相謂言：「云何比丘比丘自相打？」
translation: When the elders saw this, they said to each other, "How do the monks and the bhikṣus beat each other up?"

source_sentence: 十二法比丘聞，往具白世尊。
translation: The twelve Dharma monks heard about it and went to the Bhagavān to tell him everything.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「若比丘瞋比丘，打者，墮。」
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "If a monk who's angry with a monk strikes him, he'll fall down."

source_sentence: 時六群比丘瞋，舉杖相恐，以手相搏。
translation: When the six groups of monks became angry, they raised their staffs in fear and fought each other with their hands.

source_sentence: 十二法比丘見，往白世尊。
translation: Seeing this, the twelve Dharma monks went to the Bhagavān and told him.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「若比丘，不得舉杖相恐，以手相搏者，墮。」
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "Suppose a monk raises his staff in fear and wrestles with his hands, he'll fall."

source_sentence: 佛世尊遊舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: The Bhagavān traveled to Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時跋難陀弟子難陀語跋難陀弟子言：「我欲有所至，可逐我到彼。」
translation: Then a disciple of Vārāṇasī, Nandā, said to the disciple of Vārāṇasī, "I want to go there, so you can chase me there."

source_sentence: 便然共往。
translation: They then went with him.

source_sentence: 路逢一女人，難陀便將覆屏處為不淨行。
translation: When he met a woman on the road, Nandanavana covered his place with an impure cloth and engaged in impure behavior.

source_sentence: 跋難陀弟子見，還語諸比丘。
translation: When the disciples of Pūrṇa saw this, they returned to the monks.

source_sentence: 諸比丘往白世尊。
translation: The monks went to the Bhagavān and told him.

source_sentence: 世尊因此事，集和合僧，備十功德，佛為沙門結戒：「若比丘見犯罪藏匿經一宿者，貝夜提。」
translation: Because of this, the Bhagavān gathered a mixed assembly of monks and prepared ten virtues, and the Buddha established a precept for ascetics, "If a monk sees a crime hidden away for one night, it's Pāyānti."

source_sentence: 佛世尊遊舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: The Bhagavān traveled to Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時跋難陀釋子便作是念：「此弟子辱我小弟，今當報之。」
translation: Then, the disciple Bhadanta thought, "This disciple has insulted my younger brother, and now I will repay him."

source_sentence: 便語弟子言：「我欲有所至，著衣持鉢隨我來，亦當語檀越好供養汝。」
translation: He then said to the disciple, "I want to come to you, so put on your robe and bring your bowl and follow me here; I will also tell the patron to make offerings to you."

source_sentence: 即相隨去。
translation: They then followed each other.

source_sentence: 處處將行，從一家至一家。
translation: They went from house to house, going from place to place.

source_sentence: 視日欲中撾揵稚，時過便語弟子：「汝還舍衛，我不喜與汝共行。」
translation: When he saw that the sun was about to rise over Laoghazi, he said to his disciple, "Return to Śrāvastī; I don't like to walk with you."

source_sentence: 即還向祇桓，日已過中，比丘食已竟。
translation: He then returned to Jīvaka, and after the sun had passed, the monk finished his meal.

source_sentence: 即往白世尊。
translation: He went to the Bhagavān and told him.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「若比丘語比丘，作是語：『我欲有所至，共我到彼，當語檀越好供養汝。』
translation: The Bhagavān told him, "Suppose a monk says to a monk, 'I want to reach you, so come with me there and tell the patron that I'll make good offerings to you.'

source_sentence: 將去之後復作是語：『汝去。
translation: After he leaves, he again says, 'Go!'

source_sentence: 比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 我不喜與汝共行，我樂獨行。』
translation: I don't like to walk with you; I like to walk alone.'

source_sentence: 作如是調誑者，墮。」
translation: Those who do such deceitful things will fall."

source_sentence: (非上難陀，同字耳)佛世尊遊舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: (Not Nanda, but the same word.) The Bhagavān visited Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 佛從舍衛欲詣拘薩羅界，中道無有村落，依一山宿。
translation: When the Buddha was about to go from Śrāvastī to the Kośala region, there was no village in the middle of the road, so he stayed on a mountain.

source_sentence: 有一摩訶羅比丘，負大腐木來欲然火。
translation: There was a Mahārāja monk who came carrying a large log of rotten wood and wanted to start a fire.

source_sentence: 有黑虺蛇木中來出，比丘怖懼便失聲喚。
translation: A black viper came out of the wood, and the monk was so frightened that he lost his voice and called out.

source_sentence: 諸比丘聞，謂為被賊，即前問：「何以驚喚？」
translation: When the monks heard this, they thought they'd been robbed and asked, "Why did you startle and call out?"

source_sentence: 比丘如事答。
translation: The monks answered according to the situation.

source_sentence: 諸比丘往白世尊。
translation: The monks went to the Bhagavān and told him.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「若比丘不病，於露地聚薪草牛屎糠樹葉然火。
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "Suppose a monk who isn't sick gathers wood, grass, cow dung, chaff, and leaves on the open ground, then he makes a fire.

source_sentence: 若自然、教他然者，墮。」
translation: If he naturally makes it or teaches others to make it, he'll fall into it."

source_sentence: 佛世尊遊舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: The Bhagavān traveled to Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時尊者舍利弗來辭佛及比丘僧，欲六十日普行分衛。
translation: The Venerable Śāriputra then left the Buddha and the monks and wanted to spend 60 days traveling throughout Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時加羅檀提比丘聞舍利弗欲六十日普行分衛，即來詣佛所，頭面禮足在一面坐。
translation: When the monk Kālādanta heard that Śāriputra wanted to spend 60 days in a universal retreat, he came to the Buddha, bowed his head and feet, and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 迦羅檀提白世尊言：「尊者舍利弗懈慢，不辭別世尊及比丘僧，欲於人間普行分衛。」
translation: Kālādanta said to the Bhagavān, "Venerable Śāriputra is lazy and arrogant, and he doesn't want to part company with the Bhagavān and the monks, but he wants to go around the world defending people."

source_sentence: 時世尊即勅一比丘僧：「汝往詣舍利弗所，『世尊來呼汝。』」
translation: The Bhagavān then commanded one of the monks, "Go to Śāriputra and tell him, 'The Bhagavān has come to call you!'"

source_sentence: 時比丘即從坐起，頭面禮足而去，詣舍利弗所：「世尊使我來呼舍利弗。」
translation: The monk then rose from his seat, bowed his head to his feet, and went to Śāriputra, "The Bhagavān sent me to page Śāriputra."

source_sentence: 舍利弗與此比丘詣如來所，頭面禮足在一面坐。
translation: Śāriputra and the monk went to the Tathāgata, paid homage with their heads and feet, and sat down at one side.

source_sentence: 世尊告舍利弗言：「汝向者去不久，有此比丘來言：『舍利弗不辭佛及比丘僧，欲於人間普行分衛。』」
translation: The Bhagavān told Śāriputra, "Not long after you left, this monk came and said, 'Śāriputra doesn't resist the Buddha and the monks and saṃgha and wants to guard them universally among people.'"

source_sentence: 舍利弗白佛言：「所周行處未曾失旨，無不辭眾而行。
translation: Śāriputra said to the Buddha, "There's no place where he goes that misses the point, and there's no place where he goes without excusing himself from the crowd.

source_sentence: 但此比丘所白事誤。
translation: But this monk's explanation is wrong.

source_sentence: 譬如髦牛截兩角却，將人間行，無復觝突人意。
translation: It's like a fashionable ox that cuts off its two horns and walks among people without ever resisting their wishes.

source_sentence: 我亦如是，未曾懈慢，不辭眾而行。
translation: So too, I have never been lazy or conceited and have walked without resisting the crowd.

source_sentence: 譬如此地含容穢惡，大小行地亦不作此言：『當載此置此。』
translation: It's like this place that contains filth and evil, and neither the great nor the small walk on the ground says, 'I'll carry this here and put it here.'

source_sentence: 我亦如是，與地無異，豈當懈慢不辭眾而行？」
translation: So I am, being no different from the ground, how could I have been lazy and arrogant and not resisted the crowd in my travels?"

source_sentence: 時迦羅檀提比丘從坐起，禮舍利弗足悔過：「舍利弗！
translation: The monk Kālādanta then rose from his seat and saluted Śāriputra's feet in repentance, "Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 悔過，願恕。
translation: "I repent and vow for forgiveness.

source_sentence: 我如癡不及，我今云何謗舍利弗淨行？
translation: If I'm so deluded as not to notice, why would I denigrate Śāriputra's pure conduct now?

source_sentence: 我自前犯此妄語，願舍利弗受我悔過。」
translation: I have since violated this falsehood, so may Śāriputra accept my repentance."

source_sentence: 時世尊告舍利弗言：「時受悔過，勿令此比丘於此座上頭破七分。」
translation: The Bhagavān then addressed Śāriputra, "Accept the repentance at this time, and don't allow this monk to break seven parts of his head on this seat."

source_sentence: 時舍利弗承佛教，即受其悔過。
translation: Śāriputra then acknowledged the Buddha's teaching and accepted his repentance.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「若比丘，比丘僧常法辭比丘僧，僧聽使行。
translation: The Bhagavān told him, "Suppose a monk and a community of monks always resist the monks and community of monks according to the Dharma, and the community listens to their actions.

source_sentence: 後比丘證言不如法辭比丘僧。
translation: A later monk then testifies that he didn't resist the monks and saṃgha according to the teaching.

source_sentence: 初可，後違者，墮。」
translation: If he at first permits it but later disobeys it, he falls into it."

source_sentence: 佛世尊遊舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: The Bhagavān traveled to Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時沙彌羅云舍利弗弟子，夜不聽使房中宿，所向諸房皆不聽宿。
translation: It was then that Shamilavastu, a disciple of Śāriputra's, wouldn't listen to his messengers sleeping in his room at night, and none of the rooms to which he went would listen to him.

source_sentence: 唯有一客比丘房無人，羅云於中宿。
translation: Only one guest monk's room was unoccupied, so Rāhuṇṇa stayed there overnight.

source_sentence: 臥未久復有一客比丘至，言：「汝是沙彌，避我大沙門去。」
translation: After lying there for a while, another guest monk arrived and said, "Are you a novice? Get out of my great monk's room."

source_sentence: 即牽曳出。
translation: He dragged him out.

source_sentence: 時羅云墮淚，行詣如來廁。
translation: Luoyun then burst into tears and went to the Tathāgata's toilet.

source_sentence: 入廁屋，持如來一隻屐枕頭如眠。
translation: He went into the toilet, took one of the Tathāgata's wooden sandals, put it on his pillow, and went to sleep.

source_sentence: 有一惡蛇常居此廁，先出求食，中夜暴風雨，蛇走來趣廁。
translation: A vicious snake that always lives in this latrine first emerges looking for food, but during the middle of the night a storm rages, and the snake walks to the latrine.

source_sentence: 諸佛常法，夜三時觀眾生，誰應得度？
translation: The constant Dharma of the buddhas is that viewers are born during the three hours of the night, so who should they be able to save?

source_sentence: 見羅云正爾當為惡蛇所害。
translation: Seeing that Rāhula was right, he would surely be harmed by a vicious snake.

source_sentence: 時世尊即以三昧力往至廁上，時如來三彈指，羅云即覺。
translation: The Bhagavān then used the power of samādhi to go up to the toilet, where the Tathāgata snapped his fingers three times and Rāhula instantly realized it.

source_sentence: 世尊問：「汝是誰？」
translation: The Bhagavān asked, "Who are you?"

source_sentence: 沙彌答：「是羅云。」
translation: Śākyamuni replied, "It's Luo Yun."

source_sentence: 世尊問：「何以於此眠？」
translation: The Bhagavān asked, "Why is it that you're sleeping here?"

source_sentence: 羅云具白世尊。
translation: Luoyun fully explained to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 時如來左肘擁羅云頭，將至石室。
translation: The Tathāgata then took Rājagṛha's head by his left elbow and was about to go to the stone room.

source_sentence: 平旦世尊集和合僧，告諸比丘言：「此沙彌無父無母，唯仰和上阿闍梨隨時看視。
translation: At sunrise, the Bhagavān gathered the co-monks together and told the monks, "This śrāmaṇer has no father and no mother, so he looks up to the superior preceptor to watch him at appropriate times.

source_sentence: 不看者，誰當看？
translation: If he doesn't, who will look at it?

source_sentence: 從今已往，聽沙彌與大比丘再宿，過者墮。」
translation: From now on, I'll listen to novices and great monks who stay overnight again and fall into the category of "transgressors."

source_sentence: 佛世尊遊舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: The Bhagavān traveled to Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時闡怒比丘生此惡念。
translation: It was then that the monk Cāṇḍu had this bad thought.

source_sentence: 觀如來說法。
translation: "He observes the Tathāgata's teaching.

source_sentence: 我悉知犯。
translation: I've known all of his transgressions.

source_sentence: 此惡法者不足以為罪。
translation: This bad dharma isn't enough of a crime.'

source_sentence: 時眾多比丘聞闡怒比丘生此惡念：「觀如來說法，我悉知，犯惡法者不足為罪。」
translation: Many monks then heard this bad thought occur to the monk Cainu, "Looking at the Tathāgata's teaching, I know for certain that violating this bad dharma is not enough of a crime."

source_sentence: 時眾多比丘往至闡怒比丘所，語闡怒比丘言：「審有是語：『觀如來說法我悉知，犯惡法者不足為罪。』
translation: The multitude of monks then went to the monk Cainu and said to him, "Do you suppose there's such a thing as saying, 'Looking at the Tathāgata's teaching, I fully know that violating a bad dharma is not enough of a crime.'
Is that so?"

source_sentence: 闡怒比丘答言：「此事信然。
translation: The monk Cāṇḍu replied, "I'm sure of this.

source_sentence: 世尊說法我悉知，犯惡法者不足為罪。」
translation: I fully understand the Bhagavān's teaching, and it's not enough of a crime to violate a bad law."

source_sentence: 諸比丘語：「止止。
translation: The monks said, "Stop! Stop!

source_sentence: 闡怒！
translation: Cheonu!

source_sentence: 莫作是語，亦莫謗如來。
translation: Don't say that, and don't denigrate the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 謗如來者，現世不得善。
translation: Those who denigrate the Tathāgata won't attain goodness in the present life.

source_sentence: 世尊無數方便說犯罪惡。
translation: The Bhagavān has explained numerous ways to commit crimes and evils.

source_sentence: 汝今闡怒捨此倒見。」
translation: Now, explain your anger and abandon this mistaken view."

source_sentence: 諸比丘諫而不肯隨，諸比丘不知當云何，往白世尊。
translation: When the monks refused to follow his advice, they didn't know what to do and went to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「若比丘生此惡念：『觀如來說法我悉知，犯惡事者不足為罪。』
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "Suppose a monk gives rise to this bad thought, 'I fully know from observing the Tathāgata's teaching that committing a bad act isn't enough of a crime.'

source_sentence: 善比丘再三諫，從諫者可，不從諫者墮。」
translation: A good monk who repeatedly remonstrates with it will accept it, but one who doesn't will fall into it."

source_sentence: 佛世尊遊舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: The Bhagavān traveled to Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時闡怒比丘故習惡見，不親近比丘僧，與六群比丘為伴，受六群教。
translation: Because of this bad view, the monk Cainu wasn't close to the monks and wasn't taught by the six groups of monks who were his companions.

source_sentence: 諸比丘見，往白世尊。
translation: When the monks saw this, they went to the Bhagavān and told him.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「若比丘習惡見，已擯出，若與坐臥、言語者，墮。」
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "If a monk cultivates bad views and is withdrawn afterwards, then he'll fall into the category of those who sit, lay, or speak with him."

source_sentence: 佛世尊遊舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: The Bhagavān traveled to Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時尊者目揵連有二沙彌，不持戒、習惡法，在祇桓外各各為惡。
translation: At the time, the Venerable Maudgalyāyana had two novices who didn't observe precepts and were accustomed to bad habits, each doing evil outside of Jīvaka.

source_sentence: 諸比丘見，語沙彌言：「世尊無數方便說婬不淨，向婬念婬、婬意熾盛婬之惡露。
translation: When the monks saw this, they said to the śrāmaṇeras, "The Bhagavān has explained countless ways that lust is impure, and that mindfulness of lust and sexual intent toward lust are the bad manifestations of lust.

source_sentence: 汝等云何習此不淨？」
translation: How are you cultivating this impurity?"

source_sentence: 時沙彌答：「我等亦見如來說法，其習婬者無有罪。」
translation: The novices then replied, "We've also seen the Tathāgata preach, and those who engage in sexual misconduct aren't guilty."

source_sentence: 諸比丘復語：「汝為沙彌，莫作是語，言：『世尊說法犯婬無罪。』
translation: The monks again said, "Don't say that as an ascetic, saying, 'The Bhagavān teaches that committing sexual misconduct is not a sin.'

source_sentence: 莫謗如來，其謗如來現身不得善。
translation: Don't denigrate the Tathāgata, for denigrating the Tathāgata in his present life won't make him good.

source_sentence: 汝今沙彌，可捨惡見。」
translation: Now, you ascetics, you can abandon bad views."

source_sentence: 時沙彌不從比丘諫。
translation: The ascetics then didn't heed the monks' advice.

source_sentence: 諸比丘不知云何，往白世尊。

source_sentence: 六怨家者，喻六入。
translation: The six enemies are a metaphor for the six sense-fields.

source_sentence: 空聚者，喻六情，眼耳鼻舌身意處。
translation: 'Emptiness aggregates' is a metaphor for the six emotions, which are the sense-fields of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

source_sentence: 觀眼眼空，觀耳鼻舌身心心空。
translation: He observes the emptiness of the eye and observes the emptiness of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

source_sentence: 出門見賊者，外六塵。
translation: "He who goes out and sees a thief refers to the six external objects.

source_sentence: 山水者，四使，欲界欲使、不可使、癡使、見使。
translation: Mountains and rivers are the four tendencies, which are the tendency to desire, the tendency not to desire, the tendency to delude, and the tendency to see.

source_sentence: 河水者，三愛是，欲愛、色愛、無色愛。
translation: A river is a river, and the three loves are desire, form, and formless love.

source_sentence: 所住處有虎狼者，謂五道生死。
translation: They're the five destinies of birth and death.

source_sentence: 度彼岸者，謂泥洹。
translation: Someone who has crossed to the other shore is called a nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 栰者，八聖道。
translation: A raft is the eight noble paths.

source_sentence: 手足排水者，是勇猛。
translation: The one whose hands and feet drain is courageous.

source_sentence: 婆羅門得活者，謂如來、無所著、等正覺。」
translation: A brāhmaṇa who attains life is a tathāgata, an unattached one, and a perfectly enlightened one."

source_sentence: 佛告阿那律：「我與汝等勤苦學道，正可爾耳。
translation: The Buddha told Aniruddha, "That's exactly how I and you can diligently train on the path.

source_sentence: 是以之故，阿練兒常處樹下空處禪思莫懈。」
translation: For this reason, Aniruddha always remains in an empty place under a tree, meditating and not being lazy."

source_sentence: 時世尊因此事為沙門結戒：「若比丘與婦人同共室宿者，墮。」
translation: The Bhagavān then established a precept for ascetics based on this fact: "If a monk shares a dwelling with a woman, he'll fall into it."

source_sentence: 佛世尊遊白善山，時佛中夜起室前經行。
translation: The Bhagavān traveled to Mount Baishan when the Buddha rose midnight to walk in front of his room.

source_sentence: 時須那剎多比丘協掣子反被拘執，來恐世尊曰：「我天地大神，汝避我去。」
translation: The monk Soṇasta, who had been detained, came to fear the Bhagavān, saying, "I'm a great deity of heaven and earth; you must avoid me."

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「十八億魔來恐我，不能動一毛，豈當畏反被拘執遙來恐我耶？」
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "1.8 billion Māras fear me, but they can't move a hair, so shouldn't they be afraid to come and fear me when they're being held captive?"

source_sentence: 明旦世尊告諸比丘：「若比丘自恐人、教人恐者，墮。」
translation: At sunrise, the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "If a monk fears others or teaches others to fear, he'll fall into [the error of] his ways."

source_sentence: 佛世尊遊舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: The Bhagavān traveled to Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時六群比丘取十七群比丘衣鉢藏，揵槌以鳴，比丘僧入坐，十七群比丘索衣鉢不知所在。
translation: Six groups of monks then took the robe and bowl of 17 groups of monks and hid them there, and when the gandharva sounded, the monks and saṃgha entered their seats and asked 17 groups of monks for their robe and bowl, not knowing where it was.

source_sentence: 比丘僧會罷，還其衣鉢。
translation: When the monks finished their assembly, they returned their robes and bowls.

source_sentence: 十七群比丘語：「汝為沙門，何以盜人衣鉢？」
translation: The seventeen groups of monks said, "Why did you, as an ascetic, steal someone's robe and bowl?"

source_sentence: 六群比丘答：「戲耳，不盜。」
translation: The six groups of monks replied, "Playing with your ears doesn't constitute stealing."

source_sentence: 諸比丘聞，往白世尊。
translation: When the monks heard this, they went to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「若比丘戲藏衣鉢戶鑰鍼筒革屣及種種物，自戲藏、若教人藏者，墮。」
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "Suppose a monk playfully hides his robe, bowl, door, key, toilet seat, leather slippers, and various things, and he playsfully hides them himself or teaches others to hide them, he'll fall into the category of those who playfully hide."

source_sentence: 佛世尊遊舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: The Bhagavān traveled to Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時跋難陀釋子賒賣衣與比丘尼，後從借著。
translation: It was then that the Śākyamuni son of Vārāṇasī sold his robe on credit to a monk and nun who borrowed it later.

source_sentence: 既著衣壞，復責他直。
translation: After wearing his robe to death, he again rebuked others for being straightforward.

source_sentence: 十二法比丘聞，往白世尊。
translation: Hearing this, the twelve Dharma monks went to the Bhagavān and told him.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「若比丘賒賣衣與比丘、若比丘尼、式叉摩尼、沙彌、沙彌尼，還借著。
translation: The Bhagavān told him, "Suppose a monk sells his robe on credit to a monk, a bhikṣuṇī, a śrāmaṇer, or a śrāmaṇī and a nun, and then lends it back to them.

source_sentence: 既著衣壞，復責其直者，墮。」
translation: If he's been wearing the robe to death and is again rebuked for being straight, he'll fall into it."

source_sentence: 佛世尊遊舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: The Bhagavān traveled to Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時尊者摩訶拘致羅從拘薩羅國來至舍衛國，中路依他聚宿。
translation: The Venerable Mahākauṣṭhila then traveled from Kośala to Śrāvastī and stayed with others in the middle of the road.

source_sentence: 爾時村中夫婦共鬪，時婦逃走。
translation: A husband and wife in the village were fighting, and the woman fled.

source_sentence: 尊者摩訶拘致平旦著衣持鉢出此村詣舍衛國，道逢此婦人，問：「沙門欲何所至？」
translation: Venerable Mahākauṣṭhila then put on his robe and took his bowl out of the village and went to Śrāvastī. He met this woman on the road and asked, "Where does the ascetic want to go?"

source_sentence: 答言：「至舍衛國。」
translation: She replied, "I'll go to Śrāvastī."

source_sentence: 婦人語沙門言：「貪為伴至舍衛國。」
translation: The woman said to the ascetic, "I'll go to Śrāvastī because I want to be your companion."

source_sentence: 答言：「隨意。」
translation: He replied, "As you wish."

source_sentence: 時夫覓婦不知所在，逢一人隨道來，即問行人：「頗見有婦人西向行耶？」
translation: When the man searching for the woman didn't know where she was, he came upon a man following the road and asked the pedestrian, "Have you seen a woman walking westward?"

source_sentence: 行人答言：「有一婦人共一沙門西去。」
translation: The monk replied, "There was a woman and a monk who went west."

source_sentence: 即瞋恚往逐，捉得沙門：「汝為比丘，將我婦欲何所至？」
translation: He went after her angrily and caught the monk, "You're a monk, where do you think you're taking my wife?"

source_sentence: 時比丘答：「我不將行，此自著路行。」
translation: The monk then replied, "I'm not going to walk, but I'll walk on my own."

source_sentence: 即熟打沙門，放使去。
translation: He then ripened the monk's hand and released him.

source_sentence: 至舍衛國，向諸比丘說。
translation: He went to Śrāvastī and spoke to the monks.

source_sentence: 諸比丘往白世尊。
translation: The monks went to the Bhagavān and told him.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「若比丘與婦人同道行，從一村至一村者，墮。」
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "Suppose a monk and a woman traveling together on the same road go from village to village, and they fall into the category of those who are trapped."

source_sentence: 佛遊王舍城迦蘭陀竹園所。
translation: The Buddha traveled to the Kalandaka's Bamboo Park in Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 慈地比丘數數證尊者沓婆犯僧迦婆施沙。
translation: The monks of Cedi repeatedly testified that the Venerable Dravya had violated Saṃghabhadeshā.

source_sentence: 諸比丘聞，往白世尊。
translation: The monks who heard this went to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 世尊集和合僧，備十功德，佛為沙門結戒：「若比丘證言犯無根僧迦婆施沙法者，貝逸提。」
translation: The Bhagavān gathered the harmony of the saṃgha and prepared ten virtues, and the Buddha established the precepts for the ascetics, "If a monk testifies that he has violated the rootless Saṃghâvaśeṣa Dharma, it's Pāyatti."

source_sentence: 佛遊舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: The Buddha traveled to Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 有一比丘從拘薩羅詣舍衛國，中道至[口*蔡]羅園，與群賊相值。
translation: A monk traveling from Kośala to Śrāvastī arrived at [Mouth*Caiḍā] Park midway and met a group of thieves.

source_sentence: 即問諸賊：「君何所至？」
translation: He asked the thieves, "Where did you come from?"

source_sentence: 答言：「至舍衛國。」
translation: He replied, "To Śrāvastī!"

source_sentence: 沙門語：「相貪為伴。」
translation: The ascetic said, "We'll take each other as our companions."

source_sentence: 即與為伴。
translation: He then took them as his companions.

source_sentence: 至舍衛國，賊不著大道行，為羅護人所捉。
translation: When he arrived in Śrāvastī, the thief didn't stick to the road and was caught by the Rāhu people.

source_sentence: 羅人語群賊言：「此沙門亦作賊耶？」
translation: The Rāhu people said to the group of thieves, "Did this ascetic also become a thief?"

source_sentence: 答言：「亦作賊，為最魁首。」
translation: He replied, "He's also a thief and is the best."

source_sentence: 即將詣耆老所，具陳事狀。
translation: He then went to an elder and explained the whole story.

source_sentence: 耆老心好道德，言：「此沙門釋子終不作賊，放使去，莫復更爾。」
translation: Being well-intentioned and moral, the elder said, "This ascetic never becomes a thief; let him go, and don't do it again."

source_sentence: 此比丘至舍衛國，語諸比丘。
translation: That monk went to Śrāvastī and spoke to the monks.

source_sentence: 諸比丘往白世尊。
translation: The monks went to the Bhagavān and told him.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「若比丘知群賊與共行，從一村至一村者，墮。」
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "Suppose a monk knows that a group of thieves traveling together from village to village will fall down."

source_sentence: 佛世尊遊王舍城迦蘭陀竹園所。
translation: The Bhagavān traveled to the Kalandaka's Bamboo Park in Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 爾時尊者大目揵連將羅閱城內十餘童子為道，集諸年少沙彌七八十人，年未滿二十，次第授具足戒。
translation: It was then that the Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana gathered a group of 70 or 80 junior monks, not yet 20 years old, from within the city of Rājagṛha to confer the full precepts in order.

source_sentence: 竹園門外諸沙彌少氣多飢，喚呼索食。
translation: Outside the gate of the Bamboo Park, the novices were hungry with little energy and called out for food.

source_sentence: 世尊知而問阿難：「喚呼涕泣者誰？」
translation: Knowing this, the Bhagavān asked Ānanda, "Who's calling out for food and weeping?"

source_sentence: 阿難白佛：「尊者目揵連在外授諸沙彌七八十人具足戒。
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, "Venerable Maudgalyāyana out there has granted the full precepts to 70 or 80 śrāmaṇeras.

source_sentence: 飢不得食，是以喚呼。」
translation: They're hungry and can't get food, so they're calling out."

source_sentence: 世尊知而問目揵連：「年未滿二十，汝授具足戒耶？」
translation: The Bhagavān knew and asked Maudgalyāyana, "Are you giving the full precepts to people younger than 20 years old?"

source_sentence: 答：「審爾。
translation: Answer, "I guess so.

source_sentence: 世尊！」
translation: Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「年未滿二十者，不耐寒熱飢渴，亦不堪行道。
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "Those who are younger than 20 years old can't stand cold, heat, hunger, or thirst, and they're not able to travel the path.

source_sentence: 年滿二十者，耐寒熱飢渴，復能行道。
translation: When they reach 20 years of age, they tolerate cold, heat, hunger, and thirst, and they're again able to practice the path.

source_sentence: 若比丘沙彌年未滿二十授具足戒者，墮。
translation: If a monk or novice who has not yet reached the age of 20 confers the full precepts, he falls into the category of those who have not yet attained the age of 20.

source_sentence: 若授具足戒則非得戒，授者諸沙門犯慚愧罪。」
translation: If they were given the full precepts, they wouldn't have obtained them, and the ascetics who gave them would commit the sin of shame."

source_sentence: 佛世尊遊舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: The Bhagavān traveled to Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時六群比丘手自掘地，復教人掘地。
translation: Six groups of monks then dug their own ground and taught others to dig.

source_sentence: 諸長者見，自相謂言：「此沙門釋子云何自手掘地，復教人掘地。
translation: When the elders saw them, they said to each other, "How did this ascetic and that monk dig his own hand into the ground and then teach others to dig into it?

source_sentence: 與耕人何異？」
translation: How is he different from a plowman?"

source_sentence: 諸十二法比丘聞，往白世尊。
translation: When the 12 monks of the Dharma heard this, they went to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「若比丘自手掘地、若教人掘是置是者，墮。」
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "If a monk digs with his own hands into the ground or teaches others to dig here and put there, he'll fall into it."

source_sentence: 佛遊舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: The Buddha traveled to Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 有一長者請佛及比丘僧夏坐四月，供養供給衣裳飲食病瘦醫藥。
translation: There was an elder who invited the Buddha and the monks to sit in summer retreat for four months and made offerings of clothing, food, drink, and medicine for illness and debility.

source_sentence: 諸比丘往詣長者所請夏坐四月病瘦醫藥，或有比丘長請四月外者。
translation: The monks went to the elder and asked him to provide medicine for illness and weakness during the fourth month of summer retreat, or some monks asked him to provide medicine for the fourth month in addition.

source_sentence: 諸長者見，自相謂言：「我等許比丘齊四月裏，更無餘調。」
translation: When the elders saw this, they said to each other, "We allow monks to stay the same four months, and there's nothing more to be done."

source_sentence: 十二法比丘聞，往白世尊。
translation: When the twelve Dharma monks heard this, they went to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「若比丘受四月夏坐，往請衣裳病瘦醫藥，除其長請、或時時別請、或本一日請，若長請物者，墮。」
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "Suppose a monk accepts the fourth month of summer retreat and goes to ask for clothing, medicine for illness, and weakness, except for a long request, a separate request from time to time, or a request from the previous day, and if he asks for something long, he'll fall into it."

source_sentence: 佛世尊遊舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: The Bhagavān traveled to Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時十五日撾揵搥，比丘僧集說戒。
translation: It was the fifteenth day of Laṅkāra when the monks and nuns gathered to preach the precepts.

source_sentence: 尊者闡怒語諸比丘：「我不學此戒。
translation: Venerable Cāṇḍu said to the monks, "I'm not studying this precept.

source_sentence: 當先問博學毘尼法師，此戒有何義？」
translation: Perhaps you should first ask the learned Vinaya teacher what the meaning of this precept is."

source_sentence: 諸比丘不知當云何答，往白世尊。
translation: The monks didn't know what answer to give and went to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「若比丘說戒日便作是言：『我不學此戒。
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "Suppose a monk says this on the day he teaches the precepts, then he says, 'I won't study this precept.

source_sentence: 當先問博學毘尼法師，此戒有何義？』
translation: You should first ask the learned Vinaya teacher what this precept means.'

source_sentence: 者，墮。」
translation: If you do, you'll fall into it."

source_sentence: 世尊告諸比丘：「若不解戒，當學問比丘、博學毘尼法師，此不犯。」
translation: The Bhagavān addressed the monks, "If you don't understand the precepts, you should train as a monk or a teacher of the vibhāga.

source_sentence: 佛世尊遊拘捨彌瞿師羅園。
translation: The Bhagavān visited Kauśāmbī Ghoṣila's garden.

source_sentence: 拘舍彌比丘喜鬪諍訟罵詈誹謗。
translation: The monks of Kośāmbī were fond of fighting, insulting, and slandering each other.

source_sentence: 時六群比丘自相謂言：「此等比丘罵詈誹謗，我等誦習，明日向說之。」
translation: The six groups of monks then said to each other, "We'll recite these monks' insults and slanders, and we'll tell them to each other tomorrow."

source_sentence: 十二法比丘聞，往白世尊。
translation: When the twelve monks of the Dharma heard this, they went to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「若比丘共諍，默然誦習，明日向說者，墮。」
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "If the monks who are fighting together recite it silently and tell it to each other tomorrow, they'll fall into it."

source_sentence: 佛世尊遊拘舍彌瞿師羅園。
translation: The Bhagavān traveled to Ghositārāma's Park in Kosambī.

source_sentence: 時瞿舍彌比丘集二十僧，於中悔過。
translation: The Goswami monks then gathered 20 monks there to repent of their transgressions.

source_sentence: 時六群比丘自相謂言：「我等默然起去，使不得悔過。」
translation: The six groups of monks then said to each other, "Let's quietly get up and leave, so we won't be able to repent."

source_sentence: 即從坐起去。
translation: They then got up from their seats and departed.

source_sentence: 十二法比丘往白世尊。
translation: The twelve monks of the Dharma went to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「若比丘，比丘僧斷事未竟默然起去，不囑比坐比丘者，墮。」
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "Suppose a monk rises silently before finishing his business with the monks and doesn't tell the monks sitting there to fall in."

source_sentence: 佛世尊遊王舍城耆闍崛山。
translation: The Bhagavān traveled to the Gṛdhrakūṭa mountain in Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 時六群比丘於大眾中高聲大喚擾亂眾僧。
translation: Six groups of monks were in the crowd, shouting and disturbing the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 十二法比丘聞，往白世尊。
translation: The twelve Dharma monks who heard this went to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「若比丘，不得高聲大喚擾亂人。
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "Suppose a monk doesn't shout and shout loudly to disturb people.

source_sentence: 若擾亂者，墮。」
translation: If it disturbs them, they'll fall into the category of 'disturbance.'"

source_sentence: 佛世尊遊舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: The Bhagavān traveled to Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時尊者海從拘薩羅至[口*蔡]祇多國。
translation: It was then that the Venerable Hai traveled from Kośala to [Kou*Cai]Jeta.

source_sentence: 去[口*蔡]祇多國不遠，有龍名阿末提吐，於中住。
translation: Not far from [Mouth*Cai] Jeta, there was a dragon named Amṛtitu that lived in the middle of it.

source_sentence: 凶惡暴虐，人不得到其處，象馬駝牛驢皆不得到，鳥亦不得在上飛。
translation: It's so vicious and violent that no one can get anywhere near it, and neither elephants, horses, camels, oxen, nor asses can get there, nor can birds fly above it.

source_sentence: 時尊者[口*蔡]偈妬平旦著衣持鉢入[口*蔡]祇多國分衛。
translation: At the time, the Venerable [Mouth*Chai] Jayaprabha entered [Mouth*Chai] Jeta's part of the country with his robe and bowl.

source_sentence: 聞去城不遠，有龍名阿末提吐，兇惡暴虐，人不得到其處，象馬駝牛驢皆不得到其處，鳥亦不得在上飛。
translation: He heard that not far from the city there was a dragon named Amṛtitu that was so fierce and violent that no man could get anywhere, no elephant, horse, camel, ox, or donkey could get anywhere, and no bird could fly above it.

source_sentence: 分衛已還出城，舉衣鉢洗足舉坐布著肩上，往詣龍所。
translation: After Fenbie returned from the city, he gathered his robe and bowl, washed his feet, put his sitting cloth over his shoulder, and went to the dragon's lodge.

source_sentence: 樹下先三震，拂布尼師檀，結加趺坐。
translation: He shook his head three times before placing it under a tree, brushed his cloth against his sitting mat, and sat down cross-legged.

translation: The dragon then sent a thunderstorm and a flash of lightning, and Venerable [Mouth*Chai] Madhurā turned the rain and thunder into Upālī, Padma, Kauṇḍinya, and Potala.

translation: The dragon then thought, "This must be a great sage who wants to save me so he can come sit here."

translation: The dragon then saluted with his palms together and instructed him, "Yes, I'll give refuge to the Buddha, Dharma, and monks, and I'll listen to you as an upāsaka who will end my life and not kill anyone from this day forward."

source_sentence: 時迦留陀夷平旦著衣持鉢入舍衛，殯陀跋陀不失次第，至此婆羅門家。
translation: At the time, Kālôdayin entered Śrāvastī at sunrise with his robe and bowl, and he went to this Brāhmaṇa's house without losing order in his funeral service.

translation: The brāhmaṇa woman was terrified and said, "This ascetic and Śāriputra has extensive knowledge, and he's a good friend of King Prasenajit and a priest of Lady Mallik.

source_sentence: 今當活者，從意所索，不逆其意。」
translation: Now, if I were to live, I would ask for what I want and not disobey it."

translation: When Kālôdayin rose, the brāhmaṇa woman who saw him rise again thought, "I'll put him in a cauldron and scorch his food."

translation: She then drank it with a ladle, but never got scorched rice but got good rice, and the pot of rice flowed down to her bowl.

source_sentence: 婆羅門婦見此變化，心開意解：「此大神人來此間者，正欲度我，不來求食。」

translation: I'd like to take this pot of rice and finish feeding the monks."

translation: She returned home and said to the Brāhmaṇa, "Venerable Kālôdayin has come to this part of the city and made certain changes, so I'll prepare a meal and give it to him.

translation: The monks and nuns taught me the Dharma and attained the path of stream entry.

translation: Now, in due time, you can quickly go and listen to the teaching."

translation: Having cultivated the good roots of the previous Buddha, the Brāhmaṇa went to Kālôdayin, bowed his head and feet, and sat to one side.

translation: That brāhmaṇa had only one son, so he took the woman and summoned the son and the woman to his presence, promising the son, "If my husband and wife die, you'll see Kālôdayin as I did when they were alive."

translation: The son knelt down and replied, "I'll do as you say."

translation: Seven days later, he washed himself and put on his robes, went to Kālôdayin, bowed his head and feet, sat to one side, and said to Udaya, "Kālôdayin is my father and mother; please come to my house to get the clothing and food you need, as well as medicines for illness and weakness."

source_sentence: 又於我夫最為親厚，若當告此事者，罪我不少。」
translation: He's also the most intimate with my husband; if he were to tell me about this, I wouldn't be blamed for much."

source_sentence: 賊問：「當云何？」
translation: The thief asked, "What will it be?"

source_sentence: 婆羅門婦言：「當取殺。」
translation: The Brāhmaṇa woman said, "You must kill him."

source_sentence: 賊答：「不得殺。」
translation: The thief replied, "You mustn't kill him."

source_sentence: 婦人問：「何以故不得殺？」
translation: The woman asked, "Why can't you kill him?"

source_sentence: 賊答：「此是大種姓家子，波斯匿善知識、末利夫人師。
translation: The thief replied, "This is a son of a great family, a good friend of Prasenajit, and a mentor of Madhurā.

source_sentence: 是故不得殺。」
translation: Therefore, he mustn't kill him."

source_sentence: 婦言：「當作方便。」
translation: The woman said, "Take this as a teaching method."

source_sentence: 即詐病遣信呼。
translation: She then sent a message, pretending to be sick.

source_sentence: 迦留陀夷食後著衣持鉢來至此家，頭面禮足，在一面坐。
translation: After he had eaten, Kālôdayin came to the house with his robe and bowl, paid homage with his head and feet, and sat down to one side.

source_sentence: 迦留陀夷與說法，說法已欲去。
translation: Kālôdayin responded by teaching him the Dharma and then wanted to leave after he taught.

source_sentence: 婆羅門婦白言：「小留莫去，意貪聞陀夷說法，病如小差。」
translation: The Brāhmaṇa woman said, "Don't stay, for I'd like to hear Kālôdayin preach, and I'll be as sick as a small child."

source_sentence: 迦留陀夷復重說深法。
translation: Kālôdayinī then began again to explain the profound teaching.

source_sentence: 日沒時，此賊執利刀在後斫頭，即命斷，藏舍後馬糞下。
translation: When the sun was gone, this thief took a sharp knife and chopped off his head behind him.

source_sentence: 其日是十五日說戒，撾揵搥集僧說戒行舍羅，長一。
translation: On that day, the fifteenth, Laogârthas gathered the saṃgha to preach the precepts, which were one long.

source_sentence: 簸[口*蔡]羅問：「誰不入說戒？」
translation: Pāṭaliputra asked, "Who won't enter the assembly to preach the precepts?"

source_sentence: 比坐對：「尊者迦留陀夷不來。」
translation: The monk sat down and said, "Venerable Kālôdayin is not coming."

source_sentence: 簸[口*蔡]羅即問：「有囑授不？」
translation: Prabhūtaratna then asked, "Is there a mandate?"

source_sentence: 答言：「無。」
translation: He replied, "No."

source_sentence: 時簸[口*蔡]羅不知當云何，往白世尊。
translation: Not knowing what to expect, Prabhūtaratna went to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「諸比丘但說戒，迦留陀夷已般泥洹，少一不滿五百。」
translation: The Bhagavān told him, "The monks only explain the precepts; Kālôdayin has already passed through nirvāṇa, and one less is not enough for 500."

source_sentence: 世尊：「迦留陀夷常為我善知識，今日別矣。」
translation: The Bhagavān said, "Kālôdayin has always been a good teacher to me, but today I'll part with him."

source_sentence: 時世尊平旦著衣持鉢，與大比丘眾入舍衛國，往詣馬糞所。
translation: At sunrise, the Bhagavān put on his robe and took his bowl with him as he entered Śrāvastī with a large group of monks and went to the horse-dung heap.

source_sentence: 佛力使迦留陀夷身踊出去地七仞，諸比丘以床仰承，即下臥床上送至城外。
translation: The Buddha's strength caused Kālôdayin to leap out of his body seven feet onto the ground, and the monks supported him on a bed, where he was taken down to lie on his back and carried him outside the city.

source_sentence: 詣塚間，種種花香供養幡蓋圍繞，作眾伎樂，香油灌體而闍維之，與起偷婆。
translation: He went to a tomb, was surrounded by flowers, offerings, banners, and shrouds, performed numerous tricks, doused his body with scented oil, and maintained him, and gave him a hand up to steal.

source_sentence: 王波斯匿聞尊者迦留陀夷為某婆羅門所殺，即誅婆羅門家，左右誅十八家，捕五百賊，截手足，擲祇桓塹中。
translation: When the king Prasenajit heard that Venerable Kālôdayin had been killed by a certain brāhmaṇa, he summarily executed the brāhmaṇa's family, sidelined 18 families, arrested 500 thieves, amputated their hands and feet, and threw them into the Jetavana moat.

source_sentence: 世尊因此事集和合僧，備十功德，佛為沙門結戒：「若比丘，不囑左右比丘，非時入邑落者，貝逸提。」
translation: The Bhagavān therefore assembled a community of monks and prepared ten virtues, and the Buddha established a precept for ascetics: "If a monk doesn't tell his right-hand monk to enter the village at an ungodly hour, that's Pāyatti."

source_sentence: 諸比丘白佛：「尊者迦留陀夷本造何惡，今得阿羅漢，故為此婆羅門家所殺？」
translation: The monks said to the Buddha, "Venerable Kālôdayin, what evil did he do in the past that has now led to his attainment of arhatship and that's why he was killed by this Brāhmaṇa family?"

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「迦留陀夷往昔久遠時作天祀主。
translation: The Bhagavān told him, "Once upon a time, Kālôdayin was the head of a celestial sacrifice.

source_sentence: 有五百群賊，劫掠得物，持入舍衛國。
translation: Five hundred bandits plundered the property and brought it into Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 五百群賊截羊四足，持來祠天。
translation: The five hundred bandits cut off the sheep's four legs and brought it to the gods to be worshipped.

source_sentence: 天祠主即斷此羊命。
translation: The god-worshiper then cut off the life of the sheep.

source_sentence: 爾時五百群賊截羊四足者，今祇桓塹中五百群賊是。
translation: Those 500 bandits who cut off the four legs of the sheep were the 500 bandits in the Jetavana moat.

source_sentence: 時天祠主斷羊命者，今迦留陀夷是。
translation: The one who then cut off the sheep's life was the present-day Kālôdayin.

source_sentence: 雖得阿羅漢，不免宿對。
translation: Even though he had attained arhatship, he wasn't spared a past confrontation.

source_sentence: 爾時羊者，今婆羅門婦是。」
translation: The sheep then was the present-day Brāhmaṇa woman."

source_sentence: 時世尊說迦留陀夷昔所更，諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜作禮而去。
translation: When the Bhagavān explained what Kālôdayin had done in the past, the monks who heard what the Buddha had said rejoiced and saluted.

translation: (*Vinaya vol. 9)
